Subject: Adoption of Proposed Tournament Rules

From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

Ok, here's the reminder:

No debate in this forum about the rules.  Votes only.  Votes will be 
taken by emailing this group with either a yes or no vote for each 
section of rules or a yes or no vote for the entire set of rules.  
Anybody may vote (including those who worked on the rules).  Violation 
of these conditions will result in a mild form of punishment.  
Questions about clarification of each proposed rule are allowed as 
long as no comment about the proposed rule is made.  

example of something not allowed:  "I'd vote for this rule if it means 
. . .".

example of something allowed: "How does this specific rules apply in 
this condition?"

**PROPOSED RULES OF THE TOURNAMENT

Objective of the tournament: The objective is to score the maximum    
points possible in the tournament scenarios without cheating.  In the 
event of a tie, the following list will be used to settle ties:
1)a tie breaker scenario.  In this scenario you will be pitted against 
  a team that is a computer duplicate of your own characters with the 
  same amount of experience as each character has.  You will not be   
  allowed to hire extra characters for the tie-breaker scenario.
2)the team with no clerics
3)the team with no ghosts 
4)the team with no faeries 
5)the team with no elves 
6)the team with no mages  
7)the team with no skeletons
                 
Scenario information: There will be 20 scenarios in this tournament.  
Players will be given 1 week to complete 5 scenarios.  Every time a  
player has completed 5 scenarios, he/she must send the saved game to  
every judge for evaluation and must wait a day after the stats of all 
players are posted before going onward.

Cheating, Part 1: After all of the players have completed each set of 
5 scenarios, the stats for each team will be posted.  If any person 
feels one player has cheated to achieve certain stats, then that 
player may challenge another person's score.  Once a challenge is 
issued, the tournament is temporarily stopped until the judges can 
make a ruling about the accused cheater.

Cheating, Part 2:What constitutes cheating?  Using cheat codes to help 
go through the tournament, playing through scenarios not in the 
tournament set, tampering with the saved game file, breaking any 
tournament rules, and anything else that is used to enhance a player's 
score besides playing through tournament scenarios.  Anyone caught 
cheating will immediately be expelled from the tournament.

Judges: There will be a minimium of 3 judges.  Each judge will receive 
the saved games and use information in the saved game to post stats 
for players in the gladiator group.  In addition, if anyone challenges 
another person's score, the judges will work through the scenarios to 
determine whether or not cheating occured.  If the judges determine 
cheating has occured, they do have the power to expell someone from 
the tournament.

Extra Rule 1: No hiring any new characters after completing the 5th 
scenario unless a character dies.  In such a case, the player may only 
hire the number of characters that have died and the characters that 
are bought must be of the same character type that died.

Extra Rule 2: Each team must be composed of a minimium of 4 
characters.

Extra Rule 3:Each team may possess no more than 20 characters.
